com.samsung.android.sdk.visualview.animation

Class SVSpriteAnimation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.android.sdk.visualview.animation.SVAnimation
      • com.samsung.android.sdk.visualview.animation.SVSpriteAnimation

  • public class SVSpriteAnimation
extends SVAnimation
    This class provides the sprite animation functionality, which is created from a texture atlas.

    This Visual View package feature creates animations by using frames on the texture atlas.

    It uses one image resource and makes the animation by showing rectangles from that resource.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SVSpriteAnimation

        public SVSpriteAnimation(SVImage image,
                 int frameWidth,
                 int frameHeight)
        Creates an instance of SVSpriteAnimation.

        A Sprite image is a texture atlas consists of different texture which when shown after one another leads to the beautiful animation.

        framewidth is therefore the dimension of the one texture in the sprite Image. if the an Sprite Image contains 4 texture in a row then the frame

        width can be calculated as (FrameWidth = ImageBitmapWidth/NoOfFramesInaRow)

        Similarly Height can be calculated as (FrameWidth = ImageBitmapheight/NoOfFramesInaColoumn).

        Interesting point is total number of frame might not be always equal to (NoOfFramesInaRow * NoOfFramesInaColoumn). User must look on the sprite image so as to know the number of frames in the texture atlas.

        User can use the API SetInterval(fromframe, toframe) to choose the frames to be animated ensuring the criteria 0=< fromframe/toframe =

        Parameters:
        image - SVImage object with the resource atlas with the images to be used.
        frameWidth - Width of one frame.
        frameHeight - Height of one frame.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if frame width or height is passed as a negative value.
        See Also:
        PlayType

    • Method Detail

      • getTotalCount

        public int getTotalCount()
        Get Total count of animation frame
        Returns:
        animation frame's total count

      • setInterval

        public void setInterval(int fromIndex,
               int toIndex)
        Set the playback interval in terms of frame indices.

        The from and to index value must be less then the total frame count value of Sprite Image

        Parameters:
        fromIndex - Start frame index.
        toIndex - End frame index.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if from /to index is negative or bigger then the total frame counts
